ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.summary: Uses a kernel smoothing approach to calculate Mutual Information for comparisons between all types of variables including continuous vs continuous, continuous vs discrete and discrete vs discrete. Uses a nonparametric bias correction giving Bias Corrected Mutual Information (BCMI). Implemented efficiently in Fortran 95 with OpenMP and suited to large genomic datasets.

Uses a kernel smoothing approach to calculate Mutual Information for comparisons between all types of variables including continuous vs continuous, continuous vs discrete and discrete vs discrete. Uses a nonparametric bias correction giving Bias Corrected Mutual Information (BCMI). Implemented efficiently in Fortran 95 with OpenMP and suited to large genomic datasets.

name: r-mpmi

about.summary: Uses a kernel smoothing approach to calculate Mutual Information for comparisons between all types of variables including continuous vs continuous, continuous vs discrete and discrete vs discrete. Uses a nonparametric bias correction giving Bias Corrected Mutual Information (BCMI). Implemented efficiently in Fortran 95 with OpenMP and suited to large genomic datasets.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.43.2.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mpmi
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mpmi_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mpmi/mpmi_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b6283ae09091e9fe1ae0c05e46e1ca3934e910debc8d615fa298048f159c9089
  patches:   # [win]
    - Makevars.patch  # [win]

build:
  number: 2
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}          # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}  # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_fortran') }}        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - llvm-openmp         # [osx]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-kernsmooth
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-kernsmooth

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mpmi')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mpmi')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://r-forge.r-project.org/projects/mpmi/
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'Uses a kernel smoothing approach to calculate Mutual Information for comparisons between all types of variables including continuous vs continuous, continuous vs discrete and discrete vs discrete. Uses a nonparametric bias correction giving Bias Corrected Mutual Information (BCMI). Implemented efficiently in
    Fortran 95 with OpenMP and suited to large genomic datasets.  '
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: mpmi
# Type: Package
# Title: Mixed-Pair Mutual Information Estimators
# Version: 0.43
# Date: 2019-04-22
# Author: Chris Pardy
# Maintainer: Chris Pardy <cooliomcdude@gmail.com>
# Description: Uses a kernel smoothing approach to calculate Mutual Information for comparisons between all types of variables including continuous vs continuous, continuous vs discrete and discrete vs discrete. Uses a nonparametric bias correction giving Bias Corrected Mutual Information (BCMI). Implemented efficiently in Fortran 95 with OpenMP and suited to large genomic datasets.
# License: GPL-3
# URL: http://r-forge.r-project.org/projects/mpmi/
# Depends: KernSmooth
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Packaged: 2019-04-22 06:12:27 UTC; cp
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-04-22 06:40:03 UTC

about.summary: Uses a kernel smoothing approach to calculate Mutual Information for comparisons between all types of variables including continuous vs continuous, continuous vs discrete and discrete vs discrete. Uses a nonparametric bias correction giving Bias Corrected Mutual Information (BCMI). Implemented efficiently in Fortran 95 with OpenMP and suited to large genomic datasets.
